metadata.Title: CVE-2023-23599 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
When copying a network request from the developer tools panel as a curlcommand the output was not being properly sanitized and could allowarbitrary commands to be hidden within. This vulnerability affects Firefox< 109, Thunderbird < 102.7, and Firefox ESR < 102.7.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-23599` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '109.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.7.1+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
